title: Juventud Retalteca
text:
Club Social y Deportivo Juventud Retalteca was a <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>n professional <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="Retalhuleu">Retalhuleu</a> and who competed in the "<a href="Liga%20Nacional%20de%20Guatemala">Liga Nacional</a>", the nation's top footballing division.
History.
Nicknamed "Los Algodoneros" (the Cotton pickers), the club was founded on 6 May 1951 by José Maria Olivar and Guillermo Gordillo. The club won promotion to "<a href="Liga%20Nacional%20de%20Guatemala">Liga Mayor</a>" in 2009 after spending years in the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20Ascenso">Primera División de Ascenso</a> and defeated national champions <a href="C.D.%20Jalapa">C.D. Jalapa</a> 5–0 in the season's opener on August 1, 2009.
In February 2012, a car accident in which midfielder <a href="Daniel%20Linares">Daniel Linares</a> died left the team in shock.
They were dissolved in 2012 after surmountable financial problems.
Stadium.
They play their home games at the <a href="Estadio%20Dr.%20%C3%93scar%20Monterroso%20Izaguirre">Estadio Dr. Óscar Monterroso Izaguirre</a>.
Honours.
<a href="Copa%20de%20Guatemala">Copa de Guatemala</a> 2
